Description: Terracotta figure fragment of a horse's head. Bridle and harness indicated by incised lines and added plastic decoration. This should be from a rider or chariot group. Handmade and solid in a basic style. Surface covered with white coating. Orange red calcaric marl Cypriot fabric with pale beige-brown surfaces. Black, white, red and grey inclusions and vesicles. Marked with pencil.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ.(?)
Curator's comments: This figurine is labelled twice in pencil T on one side of the muzzle and Φ on the other (however the second character was poorly written and cound be a second 'T' ), designating this as coming from a context excavated by Petrie within the sanctuary of Aphrodite, during Gardner’s excavations at Naukratis in 1885-1886.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DA.059) (Phase 3)
